business.headline: Canara Robeco IPO opens on October 9: Check price band, other key detailsThe Canara Robeco IPO is entirely an Offer for Sale, with 4.98 crore shares being sold at a price band of Rs 253 to Rs 266 per share.

Why cyber insurance has become a must-have for individuals in IndiaFrom UPI payments to social media, our lives are increasingly online. With cybercrime on the rise, personal cyber insurance is no longer optional—it's a must-have shield.

Bitcoin hits all-time high. Can the rally last?Bitcoin has surged to a new all-time high, crossing $125,000, sparking excitement among investors worldwide. With institutional demand and strong ETF inflows driving the rally, the question remains, can this momentum continue?

GST 2.0 cuts aren't reaching most Indian consumers, finds surveyMost Indian consumers are not seeing the benefits of GST 2.0. Despite tax cuts on essentials and aspirational goods, delayed price updates and supply chain gaps keep savings from reaching buyers.

Gold prices at record high. Should you buy now or wait?Gold has hit a fresh record high, leaving buyers unsure whether to make a move now or wait for a price dip. With festive demand and global uncertainty pushing rates up sharply, the big question is — is this the right time to buy?

Tata Capital IPO opens: Check GMP, key details, and should you apply or skip?The price band has been set at Rs 310 to Rs 326 per share, with a lot size of 46 shares. This means retail investors need a minimum of Rs 14,260 to participate.

Hospital stocks rise after CGHS rate revision. Should you buy?Hospital stocks are in focus today after the government announced the biggest revision in Central Government Health Scheme package rates in 15 years. The new rates, covering nearly 2,000 medical procedures, will come into effect from October 13, 2025.
Sensex, Nifty see muted start; Tata Capital IPO in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 44.18 points to 81,251.35 around 9:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading 18.45 points higher at 24,923.

SIP vs RD: Where should your monthly savings go?Would you rather sleep peacefully or grow wealthy quietly? That's essentially what the SIP vs RD debate boils down to. Both allow disciplined monthly investing, but one protects capital while the other builds it. So which one deserves your money?

Man flags extra charge on cash-on-delivery payments, Centre launches probeThe Department of Consumer Affairs has launched an investigation into e-commerce sites charging additional fees on cash-on-delivery payments.

Agents' body questions GST cut, says move undermines insurance distributionPrashant Mhatre, All India President of the General Insurance Agents Federation Integrated (GIAFI), has sounded an alarm, saying the decision risks weakening the role of agents, brokers, and advisors who are central to India's insurance reach.
Planning a personal loan? Don't make these 5 errorsWhile personal loans can be a handy financial tool, they come with risks if mismanaged. Avoid these five common errors to keep your finances safe.

entertainment.headline: Pankaj Kapur defends depiction of toxic masculinity in Shahid Kapoor's Kabir Singh Pankaj Kapur spoke on the criticism of Shahid Kapoor's role in 'Kabir Singh'. He shared thoughts on the actor's growth as an actor and family dynamics. The veteran actor highlighted the importance of generational perspectives.

Not an easy job: Amitabh Bachchan urges women to take pride in being homemakers Amitabh Bachchan urged women to speak proudly about being homemakers, highlighting the challenges of managing a household.

Diddy verdict a cautionary reminder to young individuals with dreams: Aubrey O'Day Singer and reality TV star Aubrey O'Day states in an X post why Sean 'Diddy' Combs' 50-month prison sentence serves as a real warning to aspiring individuals

Aahana Kumra calls Arbaaz Patel the most hated contestant in Rise and Fall Actor Aahana Kumra shared her tough experiences on the reality show 'Rise and Fall'. She revealed how therapy and personal growth helped her overcome bullying and harsh judgements.

Akshay Oberoi on working with Yash in Toxic: He's a one-man walking industry Actor Akshay Oberoi is set to make his South debut with 'Toxic: A Fairytale for Grownups' starring Yash. He praised the director and Yash's confidence while expressing his eagerness for more regional cinema.

The Smashing Pumpkins cancels India debut tour: What went wrong? The Smashing Pumpkins have cancelled their first-ever India concerts in Bangalore and Mumbai. The band cited unexpected logistical challenges as the reason for the cancellation. The shows were part of their Rock Invasion 2025 Asia Tour, their first in Asia in over a decade.

Aahana Kumra says Pawan Singh's fans sent her rape and death threats online Actor Aahana Kumra revealed that she received death and rape threats from fans of fellow 'Rise and Fall' contestant Pawan Singh. Despite a public apology and reconciliation on stage, the harassment continued, forcing her to report it to the show's producers.

Bigg Boss 19 wildcard Malti Chahar wants Ashnoor, Abhishek and Farrhana out Actor-writer Malti Chahar enters 'Bigg Boss 19' as a wildcard contestant and reveals she would eliminate Ashnoor Kaur, Abhishek Bajaj, and Farrhana Bhatt first. The confident debutant opens up about her strategy, brother Deepak Chahar's support, and her plans inside the house.

Actor Saiyami Kher becomes face of Ironman India after completing triathlon twice Saiyami Kher has been named the official face of Ironman India after completing the Ironman 70.3 triathlon twice within a year. She hopes her appointment will encourage more Indians, especially women, to take up endurance sports.
Anupam Kher and family speechless after Kantara Chapter 1. Rishab Shetty reacts Anupam Kher and his family expressed high praise for 'Kantara: Chapter 1'. Rishab Shetty reacted to the appreciation.

Abhishek Banerjee's Stolen bags two nominations at Asian Academy Creative Awards Abhishek Banerjee's film 'Stolen' has been nominated for Best Feature Film (Fiction) and Best Director for Karan Tejpal at the Asian Academy Creative Awards 2025.

Sunny Sanskari... box office Day 4: Varun-Janhvi's film steady in 1st weekend Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor's romantic-comedy 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' collected Rs 30 crore in its opening weekend. Check out the day-wise box office breakup, trends, and what's next for the Shashank Khaitan-directorial.

Raghav Juyal recalls first visit to SRK's Mannat: Aryan Khan gets a whole floor Actor Raghav Juyal recalled being amazed by Shah Rukh Khan's luxurious Mannat and its strict security during his first visit to meet Aryan Khan.

Vijay Deverakonda visits Sai Baba ashram with family, fans spot engagement ring Vijay Deverakonda visited Sri Sathya Sai Baba's ashram with family amid engagement rumour buzz. Fans spotted a ring on his finger, fuelling speculation about his wedding plans with Rashmika Mandanna.

Priyanka Chopra celebrates sister-in-law Neelam's birthday with special video Priyanka Chopra shared a heartfelt birthday wish for her sister-in-law, Neelam Upadhyaya, posting a carousel of family moments.

Saiyaara's Aneet Padda opens up on scam auditions, cold emailing 70 producers Actor Aneet Padda opened up about her early struggles before fame, sharing how she once sent audition tapes and cold emails to dozens of production houses in search of work.

Kantara Chapter 1 box office Day 4: Rs 300 crore in sight, biggest Kannada opener Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' is set to cross Rs 300 crore at the box office after a strong four-day run. The film has become the third highest grossing Kannada movie, challenging previous records.

Bigg Boss 19's Abhishek Bajaj breaks silence on Akansha Jindal's cheating claims 'Bigg Boss 19' contestant Abhishek Bajaj responds to his ex-wife Akansha Jindal's claims of infidelity during their marriage. Bajaj calls the allegations "heartbreaking and deeply unfair" while urging the media not to promote negative narratives.

Smriti Irani makes runway comeback after 26 years with symbolic walk. Watch Smriti Irani made a return to the fashion runway after 26 years. She walked barefoot, which many saw as a statement of authenticity.

general news.headline: Centre probes mid-air emergency system deployment on Air India Dreamliner jetThe DGCA launched a probe into the uncommanded deployment of the emergency turbine mid-air on an Air India flight 117 from Amritsar to Birmingham. The flight was a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner that was involved in the Ahmedabad air crash.

Can scapegoating doctors ever end India's deadly cough syrup tragedies?Sixteen children are dead. A doctor is in jail. The toxic cough syrup came sealed and approved, but it's the prescriber, not the producer, who is paying the price. Once again, India shields pharma and scapegoats its doctors.

Why no notice to Sonam Wangchuk's wife, Supreme Court asks Centre over detentionWhile stating that the matter will be heard on October 14, the Supreme Court issued notices to the Centre, Jammu & Kashmir, and Rajasthan over a habeas corpus plea filed by Gitanjali Wangmo, who informed the bench that she has not been allowed to meet her husband so far.

Will bury India under debris of its own warplanes, says Pak Defence MinisterPakistani Defence Minister Khawaja Asif warned India of severe consequences, following comments from Indian Army chief Gen Upendra Dwivedi about erasing Pakistan from the world map if it failed to stop terrorism on its soil.

Hikaru throws away Gukesh's king: Was it drama or disrespect?World No.2 Hikaru Nakamura stoked controversy after beating India's D Gukesh in USA's Checkmate tournament. After his win, Hikaru picked up Gukesh's king and threw it into the crowd. Was it disrespectful, or was the drama done to grab eyeballs?

Reported sale of JF-17 jet engines to Pakistan will benefit India: Russian expertsRussian defence experts said the reported sale of RD-93 engines to Pakistan could benefit India in two ways, dismissing opposition criticism in New Delhi.

Brahmins ignite flame of knowledge in society: Rekha Gupta's remarks spark rowDelhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta praised the Brahmin community for igniting the flame of knowledge in society, leading to sharp criticism from AAP, who called her comments insensitive.

Bihar election dates likely to be announced at 4 pmThe elections will determine the composition of the 18th Bihar Legislative Assembly, with all 243 seats up for grabs. The ruling JD(U)-BJP alliance is expected to face a stiff challenge from the opposition Mahagathbandhan, which comprises the RJD, Congress, and other allies.

Path-breaking as captain, Rohit Sharma enters his final act: Can he do a Dhoni?Rohit Sharma's era as India's captain may be over, but his influence is far from finished. As mentor and elder statesman, he can shape the next generation, guide Shubman Gill, and ensure his fearless, path-breaking philosophy endures in the lead-up to the 2027 ODI World Cup.

7 patients dead in Jaipur hospital fire, families allege staff fled after blazeFamilies of the victims have alleged that the staff fled soon after the blaze, suspected to have been caused by a short circuit, erupted on the second floor of the state-run Sawai Man Singh Hospital in Jaipur.
Learn How Adobe Express Is Making Graphic Design Fun In ClassroomsThe Adobe Express app is available on any smart device or desktop computer.

Been prescribing Coldrif for 10 years: Doctor arrested in cough syrup deaths caseMadhya Pradesh Police arrested Dr Soni on Saturday after 16 children in Chhindwara and Betul districts died following consumption of Coldrif syrup.

Kolkata puja pandal recreates Air India crash, sparks fury over 'insensitive' themeA Durga puja pandal in Kolkata recreated the recent Air India plane crash, receiving widespread criticism online. The display has caused debates on the balance between artistic expression and emotional sensitivity during festivals.

Nitish Kumar inaugurates first phase of Patna Metro. Check routes, faresPatna officially joins India's metro cities today as the Blue Line opens between ISBT and Bhoothnath, with services running from 8 am till 10 pm and fares starting from Rs 15.

GST 2.0 cuts aren't reaching most Indian consumers, finds surveyMost Indian consumers are not seeing the benefits of GST 2.0. Despite tax cuts on essentials and aspirational goods, delayed price updates and supply chain gaps keep savings from reaching buyers.

Namma Metro gone? Karnataka proposes to rename Bengaluru metro as 'Basava Metro'Basavanna, revered as Vishwaguru Basavanna, was a 12th-century saint and statesman who founded the Anubhava Mantapa, the first democratic spiritual assembly, and championed equality and social reform.

Kantara Chapter 1 box office Day 4: Rs 300 crore in sight, biggest Kannada openerRishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' is set to cross Rs 300 crore at the box office after a strong four-day run. The film has become the third highest grossing Kannada movie, challenging previous records.
How IIM Ahmedabad defies placement trendsWith Rs 35 lakh average salary for the business management and Rs 20 lakh for agribusiness graduates, IIMA's placement holds steady amid global headwinds.
Nobel Prize 2025 announcements to begin today with Medicine awardThe first award, for medicine, will be announced by the Nobel Assembly at Sweden's Karolinska Institute on Monday.

No urgent relief for Sonam Wangchuk as top court adjourns plea seeking releaseEnvironmentalist Sonam Wangchuk was detained after a violent protest in Ladakh demanding statehood Sixth Schedule status left four dead and around 90 injured.

These places to witness supermoon as it rises in the skies tonightThe first supermoon of 2025 will rise shortly after sunset, making it an excellent time for skywatchers to enjoy this spectacular lunar event.

Move fast or there'll be massive bloodshed, Trump warns amid Gaza peace talksTrump's remarks come just hours after his warning that Hamas will face "complete obliteration" if it does not cede power and control in Gaza as per his peace plan. The deadline for Hamas ended at 6 pm Washington time (EDT) on Sunday -- 3:30 am IST on Monday.

Indian-origin motel owner shot dead in US after asking gunman, 'Are you alright?'The victim, Rakesh Ehagaban, was killed by Stanley Eugene West, who also shot a woman and a detective before being arrested. Investigators said the attack appeared deliberate and unprovoked.

No fire extinguishers, carried patients out: Witnesses expose Jaipur hospital lapsesSeven people were killed after the blaze, suspected to have been caused by a short circuit, erupted on the second floor of Jaipur's Sawai Man Singh Hospital, the largest state-run hospital in Jaipur.

sports.headline: I don't like attitude, arrogance: Mohammed Siraj on staying grounded after fame Mohammed Siraj reflected on his outlook on life after rising to fame as one of India's premier fast bowlers. The Hyderabad pacer said he has stayed grounded and has not forgotten his humble beginnings.

Hikaru throws away Gukesh's king: Was it drama or disrespect? World No.2 Hikaru Nakamura stoked controversy after beating India's D Gukesh in USA's Checkmate tournament. After his win, Hikaru picked up Gukesh's king and threw it into the crowd. Was it disrespectful, or was the drama done to grab eyeballs?

Barcelona did not know what to do with the ball: Pedri after Sevilla thrashing FC Barcelona fell to their first loss in the LaLiga on Sunday. Sevilla thrashed Barcelona 4-1 to hand them their biggest loss of the season so far.

Path-breaking as captain, Rohit Sharma enters his final act: Can he do a Dhoni? Rohit Sharma's era as India's captain may be over, but his influence is far from finished. As mentor and elder statesman, he can shape the next generation, guide Shubman Gill, and ensure his fearless, path-breaking philosophy endures in the lead-up to the 2027 ODI World Cup.

Wouldn't be surprised if Shubman Gill becomes India's T20I captain too: Panesar Former England spinner Monty Panesar praised Shubman Gill's appointment as India's next ODI captain and added that he wouldn't be surprised if the star opener were also handed the T20I captaincy.

Pakistan break silence on Muneeba Ali's controversial run-out vs India Pakistan pacer Diana Baig refrained from adding more fuel to the fire over opening batter Muneeba Ali's controversial run-out against India in the sixth match of the Women's World Cup 2025 at the R. Premadasa Stadium in Colombo on Sunday.

Navdeep Singh roars as India finish with record medal haul in World Para Champs One of India's favourite javelin throwers - Navdeep roared again at the JLN Stadium on Sunday, as the clinched the silver medal in F41 category. With 4 medals on the final day of the competition, India finished with their best ever medal tally.

3rd T20I: Saif Hassan helps Bangladesh complete series sweep over Afghanistan Bangladesh completed a commanding 3-0 clean sweep over Afghanistan in the T20I series in Sharjah, successfully executing their chase in all three matches.

Focus on bowling, not on India-Pakistan talk: Kranti reveals her success mantra India's newest pace sensation Kranti Gaud revealed that she remains unfazed by the hype surrounding the India-Pakistan rivalry, saying her focus is solely on her bowling. The young pacer starred with a match-winning spell as India defeated Pakistan by 88 runs in their ICC Women's World Cup clash in Colombo.

Unable to even walk due to cramps, Jannik Sinner retires from Shanghai Masters World No.2 Jannik Sinner limped off the court in the third round of the Shanghai Masters. Sinner, facing intense cramps, had to be carried out by his physio.

Women's World Cup: Dodgy India need to tighten up despite dream start India are sitting atop the Women's World Cup table, but poor DRS decisions, sloppy catching, and inconsistent batting highlight cracks that could cost them against stronger teams like Australia and England.

Navdeep Singh roars as India finish with record medal haul in World Para Champs One of India's favourite javelin throwers - Navdeep roared again at the JLN Stadium on Sunday, as the clinched the silver medal in F41 category. With 4 medals on the final day of the competition, India finished with their best ever medal tally.

3rd T20I: Saif Hassan helps Bangladesh complete series sweep over Afghanistan Bangladesh completed a commanding 3-0 clean sweep over Afghanistan in the T20I series in Sharjah, successfully executing their chase in all three matches.

Focus on bowling, not on India-Pakistan talk: Kranti reveals her success mantra India's newest pace sensation Kranti Gaud revealed that she remains unfazed by the hype surrounding the India-Pakistan rivalry, saying her focus is solely on her bowling. The young pacer starred with a match-winning spell as India defeated Pakistan by 88 runs in their ICC Women's World Cup clash in Colombo.

Women's World Cup: Dodgy India need to tighten up despite dream start India are sitting atop the Women's World Cup table, but poor DRS decisions, sloppy catching, and inconsistent batting highlight cracks that could cost them against stronger teams like Australia and England.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
